reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great pockets fits to size
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2021
review_body: Jacket took a month for delivery but that was and should be expected,  worth the wait jacket is true to size I'm 180lbs 5'7" and wear medium in most things and this was perfect size plus jacket has some stretch, sizing in description seems off they have it listed way too long but it looks and fits as pictured falls right at the hip. Also is waterproof ran sleeve of jacket under sink and when I touched the jacket after it wasn't even wet on the surface. Can't speak to durability yet but zippers could be an issue in future but only time will tell and I will update after some uses

    Nice jacket, but size up
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2019
review_body: Nice jacket with decent features for the price, but definitely runs small. I’m 6 feet, 180 pounds and usually wear a size Large. Returned for an XXL that I can comfortably layer over a thicker long sleeve shirt and vest for really cold weather. Ships from China which took weeks and return postage was over $20. Company suggested that I keep the too-small original jacket to regift and they would credit $25 to my account.

product_title: Result Mens Softshell Bodywarmer Breathable Jacket
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Nice Jacket, Sizes run large
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2013
review_body:
Never got to actually use this jacket, since I ordered a size M (which it recommends for a 41" chest - which is exactly my measurement) and it was way too big. Fits like a size L.

The price is right, and I like the features of the jacket - arm holes and waist cinch down with shockcord, nice pockets, layered softshell material is waterproof and windproof, looks pretty good.

So I'm disappointed, out a total of $15 for shipping costs and nothing to show for it. The only thing that says about the jacket is that the sizes run big, so order a size down if you want it to fit nicely.

reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Nicely made soft shell, without the hefty price tag
review_title: Nicely made soft shell, without the hefty price tag
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2022
review_body:
DEFCON 5 designs in Italy, outsourced to China. The soft shell was conventional layout, not unlike TAD, Helikon, etc. The fabrics feels a micro denser than Helikon, and has better Velcro closures… Another nice touch is the removeable hood… You can either roll it into the collar compartment, or unzip it and completely remove it, which is a handy feature… (I keep the hood stashed in the rear duck pocket of the jacket…)

The only thing I find odd are the internal pockets, which have zips that face sideways, limiting the use range of the pockets. They’re large enough to fit a few credit cards/ID cards, but not much else, which limits their utility…

product_title: Colorado Clothing Men's Summit Anorak Shell Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Unbelievable deal.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2018
review_body: I am flabbergasted at this jacket.  Seriously less than $10.  I actually had to go back and make sure that was the price.  It has triple closing (Zip from the inside, outside and velcro) The hood is well hidden in the collar. There are a couple of zippered pockets and a cord running through the middle to cinch it up to fit tighter around the midriff.  I don't know if it will be waterproof in a torrential downpour, but I don't intend to get out in that heavy of a rain, but I am sure it will repel the rain.  I am super surprised!

product_title: Colorado Clothing Men's Summit Anorak Shell Jacket
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great heavy rain Jacket.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2021
review_body:
This is a good Jacket for rain, and snow as long as you have a liner in it.
I put a liner in mine and the Jacket is very warm. It has already been through a rain shower and I did not get wet. Make sure you put silicone lube or some other type of lube on the zippers and they'll work Great. I have heard of people who use soap as a lube. Just be Careful so you don't stain your Jacket.
So far I am pleased with the order. I would have given it 5 stars if I didn't have to live the zippers before I could use the Jacket. These are very well made and should last a long time as long as I keep the zippers lubed. Other people have complained about the zippers they work Great as long as you keep them from sticking. Very easy cheap fix for a great Jacket ??

review_body: Unless you hunt in an enclosed area DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY! The "waterproof" claim is fraudulent.  After 20 minutes hunting in the rain the arms and shoulders began to seep through.  You get what you pay for but it certainly is NOT waterproof.  0 out of 5 stars if I could it one.

product_title: World Famous Sports Waterproof Breathable Camo Parka, Blaze Woodland Blaze Camo 2XL
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Well worth the money.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2014
review_body:
Nice value for the money....for an inexpensive jacket it performs better than expected and the quality compares to coats three times the price. It is not made for subzero on its own but with layering it handles the cold very well. It's fairly light in weight too ...a definite plus!

I'm very pleased so far, and glad I added it to my hunting closet. The blaze is very visible but deer didn't seem to even notice it while I was in my stand.

This is not an arctic expedition coat, but I'm not hunting muskox so it suits my needs nicely!

reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    WELL MADE...SMELLED LIKE AN ASHTRAY
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2023
review_body: I'm 6'1" 200 lbs and bought the XL.  It fit length and arm wise, but was snug...my guess because of the liner.  Still comfortable.  However, and this is speculation here; because this coat appeared to be shipped from Turkey, and because I've spent time there and know everyone smokes, this coat reeked of cigarette smoke.  As soon as I opened the package, the smell hit me like a punch in the face.  I washed it immediately and the smell is gone.  Just not what I expected considering how warm and well constructed this coat is.  Still recommend buying one, but maybe from a vendor closer to home that doesn't smoke around their products.

reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This jacket seems like a great value for the money
review_title: This jacket seems like a great value for the money
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2016
review_body: This jacket seems like a great value for the money.  It is a nice weight for cool weather.  At 40 degrees F I need a little heavier coat, but otherwise great.  I am 6'3" tall, and the sleeves fit perfectly right down to the wrist on the XXL jacket.  The sleeves are not adjustable at the wrist, but seem well fit as they are at wrist.  One thing I like about the fit of this coat is that it does not have too much fabric in front.  Even though it does not have an adjustable waistband, the jacket is well enough fitted that it does not have to be partially zipped to stay close to my body.  The color seems a little bit more blue in person than it looks on the screen.  I have received several compliments on the color.  The pocket on the chest is also nice.  It holds my iPhone in an Otterbox Defender case perfectly, which makes my phone more accessible when I am doing things.

4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Zipper is left-handed, otherwise is pretty nice.
review_title: Zipper is left-handed, otherwise is pretty nice.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2019
review_body: The open texture of the fabric has a heather look, IMHO can be both more formal and more casual than the usual fleece jacket. As expected, DWR not quite as good as on a tighter weave -- but works OK sprinkling it from a faucet. Ordered a size small, at a middle-aged 5' 8", 160 lbs. Shoulder and sleeves have generous room, tummy not so much but still OK. The inside fleece is dense, but pretty thin. Jacket seems warm enough for 40-50s but not super warm. But... the zipper is left-handed (same as US women's side) so unfortunately going to send it back. Had a Helly Hansen (men's) jacket with a wrong side zipper, and every time I pulled the zipper down with my right hand it would and not separate. YMMV, but too annoying for me.

product_title: Native Species Men's Thunderhawk Insulated Jacket,Vertigo
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I really should keep this a secret
review_title: I really should keep this a secret
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2013
review_body: Bought these last year late summer. Was surprised at the quality when they arrived considering how well made they are. I'm a firm believer in camo that matches your environment and when you are 20' up in a stand the sky is your background. To make a long story short, on Oct. 16th a 15 point 5-1/2 year old whitetail buck walked toward me on an old logging road and stopped 10 yards from my tree. He then turned sideways and the rest is history. 3rd biggest buck in the state taken with a crossbow, in cheap but effective camo. Ok now the secret is out, this is good stuff. I also bought the matching rain gear, but never got a chance to try it.

reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Everything I wanted in a ski jacket
review_title: Everything I wanted in a ski jacket
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2017
review_body: I purchased this jacket about a year ago and I love it. I bought it for skiing and now I wear it while commuting just about every day. It's incredibly warm - so warm that I'm grateful for the body vents, which I keep open most of the time unless it's a frigid day on the slopes. The pockets are insulated and keep my hands very warm. The hood is nice and big - it comfortably fits around my helmet. The snow skirt and wrist gaiters keep snow and cold out, and the back of the jacket is long enough to keep my butt warm on the chairlift.

product_title: ASICS Men's Electro Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This jacket will turn heads
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2014
review_body: I live in NYC where locals have seen everything. Well, except this jacket. This thing turns heads whenever I wear it. Some smile, some laugh, some really like it and want one. The jacket itself is great quality. It is very lightweight, true to size (I am 6 feet and 205 pounds - I got a large and it feels well). The jacket has 2 sets of LED lights on it: one on the zipper for the front pocket (purple and white blinking) and a set of LEDs (reddish/orangish) on the right shoulder. The shoulder lights can either blink, be always on or off. The jacket looks very futuristic because of the lights and the silver sheen of the jacket. More than person suggested I was from Tron or the future. Very cool overall.

reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2013
review_body: Hey all, I bought this jacket for my outdoor loving boyfriend for his birthday and he loves it! It got to Iowa in a timely manner so the company really seems to be on the ball. As for product review, I'd say it is exactly as it is described. Waterproof, breathable, wind resistant -- to sum it up Weatherproof! It has a nice soft inside and outside is still soft but durable. The hood seemed a little 'short' kind of like it was too small for the length of the coat but it is really nice with its own bill and cinchers to keep it on your head tight. We even ran the sink water over the sleeve and the water just beaded off the cloth. All in all very good jacket, just as good as 'famous name brands' like Columbia, The North Face etc.

product_title: Helikon Trooper Soft Shell Jacket Alpha Green
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    RAINPROOF!
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2019
review_body:
For some context, I previously has only either weatherproof, clumsy snowcoats or light but utterly useless against even wind, hoodies. So usually I have to make a choice, risk getting cold/wet, or go full Eskimo with the accompanying clumsiness.

As you can see from the list of features, this jacket solves the problems I have pretty well, without the drawbacks I had.

Although the product cautioned that it cannot withstand heavy rain, I've not yet gone through one that it can't take on. Not for now.
Being small is another thing I like (fit in a pouch, finally!). It does not have the thermal layer like the Gunfighter, so you might still need to layer yourself wearing it. I tend to alternate between tropical and arid areas so this is actually not a cons for me though.

Pricing is another plus. You don't usually get a functional, good looking softshell for this low.

Velcro for patches and the tacticool that make me look less dumb, are the cherries on top.

All in all, wow it IS a good jacket! Now if I can find a rainproof pant to go with it......

reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Very nice, but know what you are getting
review_title: Very nice, but know what you are getting
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2013
review_body:
I have to say that being from the U.S. I took a bit of a shot in the dark on this purchase since I was not able to physically try it on or check it out in a store prior to the purchase (I live near Boston and haven't seen Craghoppers in any stores in the area).  This  review will be mostly an initial impression type review, since I have yet to take the jacket on any particularly trying excursions.

Fit: I normally wear XL sized shirts/jackets. For this Jacket I went with XXL (I have owned a Craghoppers Corey 4 fleece for some time, and am familiar with their sizing - I attribute it to the fact that it's a UK company and their sizes simply run differently across the pond).  The sleeve length is slightly longer than a shirt would be (this is a good thing, provides more coverage). The adjustable cuffs have a great range of adjustment.

Finish: a really well made (remember I haven't tortured it yet) garment. zippers work well, seems are nicely sealed, draw strings seem sturdy. One thing to note is (as will all Craghoppers tops that are not from the Bear Grylls line) the zipper on the men's gear is on the "wrong" side for us stateside folks, zipping up with the left hand is not challenging but just takes getting used to.

Things to note:
1. This is not a "Heavy" jacket. It does keep the wind out, but I would say this is a 3-season jacket unless you put a fleece under it.
2. It does not have the ability to zip a Craghoppers fleece into it, not sure where I read that it did (another site possibly?), but it doesn't.
3. The hood is removable, but not neatly storable, unless you count in a pocket.

Overall I give it 4.5 stars. If I could zip in a liner or stow the hood in the collar, it would be 5. But those are FAR from deal breakers and the rest of the jacket really makes up for that. If you are a real outdoors person and want a nice looking jacket that you wouldn't be afraid to get some pine sap on, I would highly recommend this. If you just want to look outdoorsy in your land rover, stick to The North Fake or Patagucci.

product_description:
PROTECTION FROM COLD, WET & WINDY CONDITIONS - Named after a 19,000 ft snow covered peak in Cordillera Blanca, Peru, ‘Qaras’ comes into its own when it is cold and wet or windy around. The water proof, wind proof fabric keeps you dry in winter showers or wet snow while the high loft fleece lining keeps you super warm. Qaras is tailor made for Seattle weather or for the windy city, Chicago. WATERPROOF, BREATHABLE JACKET - Water proof, wind proof 3 layer 4-way stretch fabric provides protection without restricting motion. Pit zips provide additional option for improved venting and temperature control. Fabric Waterproof rating – 10,000 mm, Fabric Breathability rating – 10,000 g/m2 - NOTE - Fabric is waterproof but SEAMS ARE NOT TAPED, so water may come in through the seams in heavy or prolonged rain. SUPER WARM WITH HIGH LOFT FLEECE - Super soft, high loft fleece provides warmth and is comfortable. The heft and comfort of Qaras makes you feel as if you are putting on a well worn, leather jacket. MADE WITH HIGH QUALITY MATERIALS - Twin zippered, hand-warmer pockets, Adjustable attached hood, YKK dual color vislon zippers, Velcro cuff adjusters, hem cinch cord. PERFECT FOR SKIING, SNOWSHOEING OR CASUAL USE - Alpine skiing, snowshoeing, bouldering, hiking or just stomping around town, Qaras can handle them all.
SIZING - Sizing is running slightly small. We recommend going one size up. Especially, the Small size is more like XS.

reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great jacket. Excellent value. Highly recommended
review_title: Great jacket. Excellent value. Highly recommended
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2019
review_body: I was looking at upgrading my current jackets and considered several high-end ones (different Arc'teryx, Northface, etc.) and after researching them (too much time) had nagging concerns that each had some disadvantages for me. Found Mishmi Takin and decided that, rather than try to find one all-purpose jacket, would get 2 different compatible ones. Stumbled across Mishmi Takin and was delighted to discover them. Bought both a Qaras and a Cayambe - just lovely jackets. Very well made, waterproof, windproof of course. But what was best about them was each is both extremely light for what it is (couldn’t believe how warm for how relatively thin the Qaras is) AND stylish (yeah, I admit that the fit is important.) Highly recommended

reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great Cold Weather Softshell
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2016
review_body:
I've been using this jacket daily for about 1.5 weeks. I've used it as a casual jacket to wear everyday, during light aerobic activity, and in the elements around Washington state. I'm 6'2" 170 lbs and the medium fits me very well. It would be a tight fit to wear more than a single layer underneath this jacket. The jacket weighs 1 lb 14 oz or 850 grams.

Positives:
Great fit
Solid build quality and high quality material selection
Long pockets that can be used with a backpack waist belt but comfortable in normal situations
Long armpit zippers for great ventilation
Excellent breathability
Good adjustability. 3 sets of cordlocks allow you to adjust the waist, hood height and hood circumference for a tight fit.
Looks really great, the lines and accent colors (mine was dark blue with orange accents) are an excellent touch.

Negatives:
Uncomfortable seam along the armpit and upper arm. Not bad with long sleeves underneath but in a t-shirt it can be uncomfortable.
Heavy compared to a fleece insulation layer + rain jacket.

Uses:
I wore the jacket in ~50°F weather with a t-shirt on underneath. I was sitting outside for about 2 hours and was not moving around much. I was starting to get cold but it was manageable.

I wore the jacket in ~40°F weather with hard rain and wind for several hours while staying active. I wore a long-sleeve wicking layer underneath. The rain soaked through the jacket after about 90 minutes which isn't unexpected, not many clothes can handle heavy rain for that long. I remained warm and the cordlocks on the hood helped to make a tight seal to not let any additional rain in. It held off the rain better than my Marmot rain jacket does.

I wore the jacket on a short jog in ~50°F weather. I was warm but didn't need to open the underarm vent zippers. The breathability of this jacket is really impressive. If I were wearing my fleece and rain jacket I would have been much hotter. It's clear that a lot of thought and effort has gone into making this softshell breathable. This jacket should easily be able to handle freezing temperatures if you're active.

reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2017
review_body:
To start with I order a ton of products and very rarely leave a review. I love this jacket so far!

I live in Ga, ordered this jacket for a medium cold weather jacket for home and travel. Fit is excellent, love the cut and style, hood wears and stays where it's supposed to. Heading to Iceland in a few weeks and I will update review after.

reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Well, I like it.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2016
review_body:
I grew up in Nebraska and spend 17 (too many) years there.  I've been through harsh winters.  But I don't remember them at all.

I've lived in tropical climates for the past 12 years and am currently in North Carolina.  Winters here sit at a regular low in the mid 20s; we usually get highs into the high 40s, maybe the low 50s even. Suffice to say, I'm spoiled.

I ordered this jacket to survive this winter, which is promising to be a cold one.  Middle of December and it's already dipping into the 30s! Brrrr!  And survive this jacket will do!  The "high loft fleece" layer is relatively thin, which keeps this jacket nice and light, but it also keeps me warm.  I've worn it outside walking the dog (who, at 5 AM, feels as if she must investigate every blade of grass in the neighborhood) when it was close to 0C outside (see what I did there?  Tricked you!  Kept you on your toes!) and I was fine.

Wind does not penetrate this jacket at all.  The hood is snug enough that you don't create a small wind tunnel around your head like jackets that are designed to be worn with a helmet; another benefit to the hood is that it's not designed to be removed, which always leaves gaps in the material coverage.  At the wrists is a perfectly placed piece of hook-and-loop fastener which isn't quite as strong (or loud) as Velcro, but does more than an adequate job at sealing the sleeves around a pair of gloves.  If you were active, you may be interested in unzipping under the arms to allow extra ventilation.

My only complaint with this jacket is that the pockets only have lining on one side of the inside.  You won't keep both hands warm using these pockets, only the side of your hands away from your body.  On the side your palms would sit is a mesh fabric.  This means that if you're cold outside and leave the pockets unzipped, be prepared for that inevitable breeze that hits just right to blow right through the jacket.

I guess it could also use a chest pocket, but now I'm just being picky.

product_title: Red Ledge Men's Reprieve Jacket Soft Shell Jacket
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Nice jacket
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2011
review_body:
I think this is supposed to be a snowboarding jacket for spring days but I use it as a casual wear around jacket and love it. I'd been searching for about 3 years for a good, simple, brown jacket and my wife finally bought this for me for Valentines day and I've been thrilled ever since. It seems to be made well and is warm enough for any SoCal evening and probably good for most evenings in the Spring/Fall elsewhere.

There are only two minor criticisms:
1) I wish it had a left breast pocket. I have another black jacket that is similar and it has this extra pocket. I find it to be extremely useful as I don't like to carry things in my jeans.
2) The sizing seems to be a bit strange. I normally am between a medium and large (I wear a size 42S suit jacket) and with this jacket, it didn't really fit until I got the small. I think it really depends on the style and how you like your jacket to fit, but for me the sizes were just too big. Consider that before you buy.

Other than that, this is an excellent jacket, thus the 4 star rating.

review_title: Im verry pleased and super warm ,money well spent!
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2017
review_body: I'm 5'10" 185lbs I ordered the XL and it fits perfectly. it's warm as HELL inside this jacket the second I put it on I could tell it's made good,it has 2 huge deep pockets inside for gear like flashlights and such also has arm pit vents the arm pits have zippers incase you over heat,the back of the forearm is extra padded they knew that thats a high wear area of a jacket.the whole jacket screams quality & the material is high quality ,I got the Coyote color and it's a true Coyote,the hood fits snug and I like that because if you have to run while the hood is on it won't flop all over the place,there's draw strings inside to pull the jacket closer to your body,,all in all I'm happy, if your bigger than 5'10 185lbs I would get the XXL

reviews:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    coat runs large, looks sloppy
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
review_body:
I purchased this in the size tshirt I wear.  The overall fit feels sloppy and I literally am swimming in it.  I had two large culf folds on each arm and they are still too long in to arms (I usually only have to fold over the cuff once).  I dislike the pockets and reszipping the liner into the coat is a pain.

The black lining jacket is okay, but again feels sloppy.  There's no piping or other distinguishing marks so it's just a very "blah" black jacket.  I definitely blend into he shadows and when it's dark out even I don't know I'm there!

I didn''t get a good feel for this coat until we got colder conditions or I would have returned it.  It was a little spendy, but I hope to find it a good home!

reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019
review_body: I am an HVAC/R tech and service laboratories deep freezers. I could never find waterproof, warm gear. We had to de ice a coil in the deep freezer, -28 degrees. Walker and Hawkes - Men's Wax 3-in-1 Greendale Jacket
Walker and Hawkes - Men's Wax 3-in-1 Greendale Jacket
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Nice jacket. UK sizes are NOT the same as US sizes
review_title: Nice jacket. UK sizes are NOT the same as US sizes
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2022
review_body:
First, if you're curious how a British style waxed jacket may fair or adapt to a North American climate, just remember Filson is an American company offering similar clothing.

Second, this jacket is very well made and very comfortable. It is a touch looser than a Carhartt 2XL Detroit jacket I own, despite being marked as 3XL. If you compare measurement sizes(I suggest looking at their actual website vs sizing info here on Amazon), this won't be a surprise. But if are counting on a 3xl=3xl, you'll find your jacket is a little more fitted\tailored than you might expect.

Though I must say. It IS my best fitting jacket, and articulates well as I move around. But the downside is I cannot layer much underneath. Though with the zip in\out vest liner, you may not need them.

I purchased after thinking about buying something that starts with a B.  I'm not disappointed. This came with the the hood and a zip in liner for less money.
Have since placed a 2nd order for a jacket for my wife as well.

All that to say... I may still buy a Barbour someday. One cannot have too many jackets, you know. ;-)

product_title: Walker and Hawkes - Men's Wax 3-in-1 Greendale Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Arrived early, fits great, and super comfortable!
review_title: Arrived early, fits great, and super comfortable!
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2022
review_body:
I am 5'11", 235 pounds, with long arms, and a 50" chest.  The size chart suggested I get the 3XL, but, I read that these tend to run a bit large, so, I ordered the 2XL.  Glad I did - perfect fit, with room for layers.  I'm almost looking forward to a rain storm so I can test out the water repelling functionality!  Out of the box, with the liner attached, I put it on over a heavy sweatshirt, and there was plenty of room to move - very comfortable, and warm, even on a blustery cold New England day.

I ordered this Feb 24.  Coming fastest shipment, it was expected March 2; it arrived Feb 28 - 2 days ahead of schedule.

I will say that the zip is a bit fiddly, but, I imagine that is more a "learning the item" issue, rather than a defect.

reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    A robust standalone rain jacket or extreme weather rain shell
review_title: A robust standalone rain jacket or extreme weather rain shell
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2021
review_body:
This jacket is very well made, with a thick outer garment, and can be used as an actual stand alone jacket for the warmer winter days. I do believe it was made in mind for very cold conditions where it would serve as an outer layer for a warm jacket underneath and for that reason it is on the loose side with extra room in the mid section.
Length is ok and overall I think this jacket looks good.
I do not advise this one for any active use unless it's in extreme cold because it is not as breathable as lighter rain shells and the pit zip vents are not as big or effective as other jackets I owned like the precip jacket.

reviews:

    A jacket for the future
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2010
review_body: I wanted a warm jacket that I could just wear over a sweater or tshirt. WOW.  This is it.  It has these scientifically made shinny over thingys inside of it that reflect the heat back onto you.  So you can stay 20% warmer then the thickets of all thick jackets.  So you are getting the warmest and thinest jacket ever made.  That is basically amazing if you ask me.  Its a little tight on the waist so it gives you incentive to eat right. hahaha, because Im not going to spend 140 on a jacket and then get fat. Buy it now.

product_title: Columbia Men's Thermodynamic Softshell (Charcoal, Small)
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great softshell jacket!
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2010
review_body: I was impressed with this jacket from the minute I put it on; it fit my frame perfectly and looked great. This is my first softshell so I can't compare it to similar jackets, but so far it has exceeded all of my expectations. It's a bit pricier than comparable softshell jackets, but I feel the performance of this jacket is well worth the money. It allows for full movement and was obviously designed with the active sportsman in mind. Water runs right off of it and it takes a while in a good rain for it to start to hold on to any water. The omniheat definitely does its job in this jacket and has kept me warm while outside at temperatures below freezing. The collar, waist, and cuffs were all designed to keep the wind out and they do a great job of it even when I'm biking.

Columbia Men's Glacier To Glade III Parka
Columbia Men's Glacier To Glade III Parka
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Value for money
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2011
review_body: Very impressed so far with this 3-in-1 parka. It's very, very warm with the liner zipped into the shell. The inner portion works well by itself in above-freezing temperatures. Connecting and disconnecting each part is not too complicated, though the zippers all around are not the best and I get the impression they will be the first things to fail on the coat. Fabric was caught in one of the side pocket zippers to start with and it was a challenge to fix it without tearing anything. It's made in China which is a bummer but for the price it seems to perform as well as much more expensive options. I got a size medium and it's a perfect fit (5'9, 150lbs). If you think you're between sizes, opt for the next one up. This is not a baggy or relaxed-cut coat. Overall very satisfied so far - here's hoping it lasts more than one or two seasons.

product_title: Columbia Men's Glacier To Glade III Parka
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    -25ºC and snow no problem
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2010
review_body:
After just one day of wearing this coat I'm pretty confident that it's pretty much what I was hoping it would be. -25ºC windy and snowing outside, I wore this coat and just my dress shirt and tie (plus my combo clava) as I rode my bike to work, and I was still warm.

However, I find it strange that the zipper is on the wrong side.

product_title: Columbia Men's Glacier To Glade III Parka
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great but very slim fit
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2010
review_body:
I like everything about this jacket save for one thing: the fit.  I ordered a small because I wear small, sometimes medium sized, jackets, and based on the fit of Columbia gear I've bought in the past I thought a small would be fine.

Well, when I received the jacket I found out how wrong I was.  Thus my advice to anyone looking at buying this or a similar jacket from Columbia this year is to lean towards a larger size if there is any doubt about the fit (and perhaps even if there isn't), particularly if you have much weight on your stomach.  The chest was about what I expected, but the waist and shoulders of the jacket were VERY slim.  The bottom of the jacket barely fit over my belt and the tightness in the shoulders and upper arms made me look like I was wearing a full-body cast.

Fit aside the rest of the jacket is pretty great.  The liner jacket is what keeps you warm and it does a very good job of that.  The shell is supple yet very resistant to the elements, so with the liner in place you've got something that is heavy-duty against both cold and inclement weather.  If the fit were looser in the upper arms and the bottom I'd give this 5 stars.

product_title: Columbia Men's Thermarator II Tall Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    The jacket is nice. The lining is bonkers.
review_title: The jacket is nice. The lining is bonkers.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2014
review_body:
If you don't mind the crazy lining on this bad boy, it's really quite nice.

Sizing seems about right. I bought a 3XL, and it fits similarly to other 3XL jackets I own from other brands. It might be a hair tighter or snugger than my other 3XL jackets, but not so much that I'd recommend ordering a size up from your usual size.

Interestingly, I paid about 30 dollars when I ordered mine, and the prices seem to be much higher now. Guess I snuck in at the right time and lucked out. For 30 dollars, I'm rather pleased. If I wanted to order a 3XL as of writing this review, the prices are higher ($48 or $97, depending on color). For 30 dollars, I'm pleased. For 48 or 97, I'd be less pleased.

The jacket is comfortable. It feels flexible and stretchy enough to be comfortable (as opposed to some jackets that are stiffer and less comfy). Yet it feels substantial enough to be warm. Granted, I'm writing this review in August and I live in New Mexico... so I haven't gotten to put the jacket through its paces in real cold conditions yet. But it feels like it will be quite warm. I can already tell it'll be too warm for me to wear it in summer or late spring. I might stash it in my car for my wife during those seasons just in case we run into a super-cold movie theater. But it feels too warm to get much use between from April through September, or thereabouts.

Depending on whether you value fashion over functionality, the lining might be a problem for you. The lining is bananas. No other way to say it, really.

When you click around and look at Columbia's "Omni-Heat" jackets on Amazon, there's a reason why they are engaging in very strategic photography. They're trying to mainly show you the jacket zipped up as much as possible, because the interior lining is bonkers. It's shiny and glittery looking. Like you're wearing one of those emergency survival blankets made of foil.

Of course, if you're talking about an item of clothing meant to keep you warm, why is it a bad thing for it to employ heat-retention technology? So... I can only speak for myself, but I don't mind the lining, personally.

I'm a bit of a dork. And anybody who knows me would take one look at the lining and then nod knowingly, because they know that it's probably a point of pride for me to be wearing clothes that are so functional. Anybody who doesn't know me, on the other hand, might think I'm wearing a lady's jacket (or a really flamboyant dude's jacket) if they get a good glimpse of the flashy lining.

You might need to wander away from Amazon to find better pictures of the lining, to get a better idea of whether it's a deal-breaker for you.

One thing I really like about the jacket is the sleeves. The sleeves have smaller, elastic sleeves sewn into the openings. This means that the elastic bit of the sleeve clings tightly enough to your wrist/hands to prevent too much cold air from getting in. It just looks like you're wearing a long-sleeve black t-shirt underneath the jacket, which isn't bad.

reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great jacket but product pic misleading
review_title: Great jacket but product pic misleading
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2022
review_body:
I ordered this last minute before a ski trip to Wyoming. The photo shows a yellow/black jacket. The description does give the color code of the jacket, however unless you’re familiar with TNF’s color code you wouldn’t know you were ordering an all black jacket.

It was too late to send back since I was leaving for my trip so I went with it. Aside from the color issue I was very happy with the jacket. The new fabric technology seems to work just as well as goretex and I love the throw back design. I can’t speak to durability as I’ve only skied with it 3 days but I’m very pleased with the quality. I’d give the product itself 4.5 stars. I understand using a color jacket to show the design but it would have helped to include an all black jacket in one of the photos to alert and clarify the color you were ordering.

Shipping was also great. I sent a note and requested they send it out asap since it was scheduled to arrive the evening before I left. It arrived a day early and seemed evident they made a conscious effort on a weekend to get it shipped out to me. Very appreciative for that.

5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Fantastic Coat
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
review_body: I purchased this now, while it was still in stock so I haven’t worn it yet therefore I cannot speak to how warm it is. It is however, insulated and it has a little weight to it and the outside shell has that windbreaker/ waterproof feel to it so I have no doubt that it will be nice and cozy this winter. Now then, and this is with absolute certainty, they do run big in size. I typically wear an XL but after reading the reviews that stated how big it was, I went ahead and ordered a size down and went with the large. Sooo glad I did! It fits perfect and looks great. No inside pocket though. Definitely worth the money.

product_title: ARIAT Men's Fr Workhorse Insulated Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great coat
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
review_body: Runs a little big, at least for my build anyway. Normally wear a 2x, ordered this in XL because FR gear tends to run big. The XL was still a little big, I’m 6’2” and 250. One wash took care of it and it’s warm, durable and comfortable. I normally don’t care for big coats because of the bulk they add and will usually just wear a jacket. This coat is great and doesn’t really add a lot of bulk. As far as price, I’m not sure it’s worth $300 but it is FR gear and it is Ariat so I expected it to be pricey before I even started looking.

reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Port Authority brand good, materials a little slick, has sleeveless inner vest
review_title: Port Authority brand good, materials a little slick, has sleeveless inner vest
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2019
review_body: Bought Port Authority due to previous clothes product owner.  This product's outer shell material is slick/nylon and 'crinkly' noise as if it were a rain jacket so buy only if ok with these aspects.  It is slightly large / loose fitting and the hood is not collar-tuckable/hidden (most jackets aren't although hard to find).  The inner liner is removable sleeveless cotton fleece vest, I was hoping for sleeved version.  In terms of overall material quality, the outer shell I rate 6.5/10, the inner shell 6/10.  No signs of workmanship problems, it's just I expected a more durable, slightly thicker, higher quality material all around.  Risk of buying mail order clothes.  I would use jacket for rain, but is not as breathable so not otherwise.  I sue the inner vest separately as it is lightweight though.  Would I buy again?  hmmmm.

product_title: Columbia Men's Coupe De Main Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great jacket. Thin, warm, and light!
review_title: Great jacket. Thin, warm, and light!
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2012
review_body:
I got this jacket on sale and I'm very happy with my purchase. I got this from altrec through amazon and the product arrived in 3 days! The jacket fits just like any other Columbia products I've owned (Not awkwardly fitted like the melting point jacket). This jacket fits just like the ascender jacket without the hoody. I'm 5'9 178lbs and the large fits great. It has a relaxed fit. If you want a fitted look like the model in the pic, get a medium but a medium will feel uncomfortable in the arm pit area. The large is perfect for me.

Update

I wore this outside for 30 min and it was very warm. It is very windy and cold today in Seattle area but I felt no air go through this jacket and was comfortably warm. This puts my newly acquired $130 Northface jacket to shame. I've owned a $220 NF jacket before with 800 fill down jkt and I like my new Columbia better. I find it interesting that TNF couldn't come up with an idea like omni heat.

product_title: Mountain Warehouse Torrent Mens Waterproof Jacket
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Quality decent for the price. Runs BIG.
review_title: Quality decent for the price. Runs BIG.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2020
review_body:
For the price and being waterproof, my expectations weren't too high. But it's still a decent & lightweight rain jacket for spring/summer weather. The stitching at the seams doesn't seem like it'll hold up over time, but it should last a couple seasons without an issue.

I tested it in during a rainy morning walk and it kept me dry. Not sure how it would hold up in a downpour over long periods, but light/medium rains are no problem with this jacket.

Just note that this jacket runs BIG. For reference, I'm 5'8" and 155 lbs with athletic build. I'm usually somewhere between a small/medium depending on brand. But with this, even the XS is big on me. The XS fitment is good in the shoulders and sleeve, but there's a lot of extra room in the mid-section. Definitely good for people with bigger stomachs. I have a similar jacket made by Columbia in size medium that's smaller than this jacket in size XS.

product_title: Manfrotto MA LSS050M-XLBB Men's PRO Soft Shell Jacket - XL (Black)
product_description: Abrasion protection shoulder and elbow patches     Side entry chest pockets     Pocket for point-and-shoot camera     Can be used with Pro Photo Vest as thermal protection
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Stylish, sophisticated, functional
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2012
review_body: Great Italian fit which means it runs lean.  Wonderful workmanship and great fabrics. Very comfortable. Plenty of little storage pockets -- you'll need a map to find everything.  My only complaint is with Amazon, not the product.  The jacket was offered for 169 with rebate. When I ordered, the price had increased to 176 with rebate.  I ordered thinking the lower price was gone.  A week later, the lower 169 price appeared.  Amazon wouldn't match the lower price, unless I packed it all up and returned it.  Nordstrom or Saks? --  No problem, the differential would have been returned -- with a smile.  Amazon? They told me no deal.  They still have a lot to learn about customer service.  Great product with this Manfrotto Jacket.  Everything I expected and more.  Amazon?  A total let down.  Very disappointed in them, negative 5 stars....

reviews:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    OK fit for a base layer, really inadequate zipper.
review_title: OK fit for a base layer, really inadequate zipper.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019
review_body:
My husband wears a large to XL tall. He has long arms and a barrel chest. The positives: The sleeves are plenty long enough which makes him very happy. The color is an approved one for work so he can wear it with his uniform. With the fleece on the inside, he finds this a comfortable and appealing layer.

On the downside, The fit is barely enough and he called this more of a large tall than an XL tall. It fits him very closely like a base layer. He could not wear this over a sweater or anything heavier than a t shirt. His primary criticism is that the zipper is very light and pulls apart very easily. The zipper teeth are small and plastic. I put it on me (it's huge on me) and the same thing happened, the zipper constantly giving way and pulling apart.

We could not think of any reason to wear this fleece side out with the smooth layer on the inside. It made no functional sense to us. We are not "reversibility" people so maybe that has more value to others. I would think the fleece out would pick up lint like crazy.

Conclusion: he will wear this over a tee and in moderate weather for rain and wind protection. Happy with the sleeve length and color. Upset about the flimsy zipper.

product_title: ATG by Wrangler Men's Reversible Classic Jacket
reviews:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Awkward in-between jacket
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
review_body:
This jacket just isn't right for me. That doesn't mean it couldn't be right for you, but I found a few flaws, to my taste.

First, it's supposed to be reversible, but I really didn't like the feel of the nylon on my skin. Maybe if you're wearing a long-sleeve shirt? But with short sleeves it feels kind of gross as after a little time some sweat starts building up against the nylon. So, as far as I'm concerned, that's one strike.

Second, the cut seems to hang a little strange on me. Not sure what it is about my proportions, but this Nehru-jacket, collarless look just doesn't look right.

Third, it is too heavy for slightly cool weather, but too light for really cold weather. It could work be a good jacket to keep in the car if you live in San Francisco. You know, you always need a jacket in the car in San Francisco. But unfortunately, not where I live. Where I live, there are only a few weeks a year where this would be the right choice. It's an awkward in-between jacket.

So I can't get on the bandwagon of good reviews for this one. It's OK and I will probably wear it a few times a year just to mix things up. But it won't be in regular rotation, unfortunately.

review_title: nice warm lightweight weather-resistant close-fitting jacket

review_body: This is a nice warm lightweight weather-resistant close-fitting jacket. I weigh 160 pounds and the jacket fits me well over a light shirt, but the sleeves and shoulders are too snug to wear the jacket over a sweater or sweatshirt. product_title: ATG by Wrangler Men's Reversible Classic Jacket

    Good choice when a jacket is not enough but a coat is too much.
review_title: Good choice when a jacket is not enough but a coat is too much.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2019
review_body:
I machine washed it and dried it without issues.

This is a coat that is between a jacket and a full blown winter coat. It is lined enough to be warmer than a regular jacket and is reversible. This makes it a good choice when a jacket is not enough but a coat is too much.

Pockets in both directions (worn padded side or waterproof side out)

It runs a bit small, around a half size small, I think due to the padding. . The Long is actually long which is a big plus. The arms are a bit wider as well.  A XLT is a bit big in the torso but the right length on  a 6ft 1 inch 155 pound young adult with long arms but who is a really lanky build. On a 5ft 10in, 175 lb guy  with large shoulders and arms it fits well across the torso and body w with only a t shirt underneath but is a tad long. He normally wears an XL jacket but has a sweater or sweatshirt on underneath, no room in this jacket. The extra width in the arms comes in handy if your arms are a bit more built.

product_title: ATG by Wrangler Men's Reversible Classic Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Two jackets in one
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019
review_body: This is an extremely versatile jacket. Overall I’m very happy with it all around. Living in Alaska, it needs to be able to handle extensive cold winter weather. So far this jacket is handled numerous trips outside for camping and hiking and temperatures well below freezing. The jackets office in credibly. The polyester outer shell does a tremendous job at keeping you warm and dry on the inside. Typically when outside I wear the black color jacket showing on the outside. The pockets Friday ample storage and a great place to keep my hands warm if need be. The lighter gray side is also equally warm and dry., But it does tend to get dirty relatively easy, so I just Generally  reserve the side For more casual situations. This jacket looks great with a pair of hunting pants out of the woods all day, as well as it does with a pair of khakis or slacks going out to a nice dinner with friends or family. I wanted the large size wanting  some room to layer clothes underneath. But overall I found it to be very true to size. And I am extremely happy with it so far.

Happy with the jacket overall, its very true to size, nice feel, good zipper etc.

Only thing is I would like to see is that the bottom to have either a slight taper or have a cinch in the bottom. I felt the bottom half was larger than the top. Lastly it needs to have tear away tags. I also didnt like the tag on the soft side and its very difficult to remove. If there ever is a version 2 or a modern take of the "classic jacket" those are some things to consider.

product_title: ATG by Wrangler Men's Reversible Classic Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Nice lightweight jacket
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020
review_body:
Nice lightweight jacket but it runs a bit small, around a half size small, I think due to the padding.  The measurement down  is actually long which is a big plus. The arms run a bit wider as well.  A XLT is a bit big in the torso but the right length on a 6ft 1 inch 165 pound young adult with long arms but who is slender .  On a 5ft 10in, 185 lb guy with large shoulders and arms it fits well across the torso and body w with only a t shirt underneath but is a tad long. He normally wears an XL jacket but has a sweater or sweatshirt on underneath, no room in this jacket. The extra width in the arms comes in handy if your arms are more muscular.

The weather cannot be too cold but nice to have on hand for the spring and colder summer nights.  And , a refreshing change to constantly wearing sweatshirts and hoodies.  The color is great which matches  most clothing.

product_title: Columbia Men's Carabineer II Parka
reviews:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Carabineer Parka
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2011
review_body: What a waste of good money! After approximately two years of ownership, I find this jacket to be insufficient to keep me warm even on days when temps are in the 30's. The hood, if you can call it one, is useless. Do yourself a favor and buy a lower-priced winter jacket at Sears or some other big-box store where you can examine the jacket for warmth and overall quality. You'll save a lot of hard-earned cash and be happier with your purchase than I am with mine. In general, I recommend you stay away from Columbia and Northface - they are ripoffs! The only reason I did not give the coat one star is because it has not fallen apart after wear - yet!

product_title: Columbia Men's Carabineer II Parka
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Just about perfect!
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2011
review_body:
This jacket is the best I've ever owned.  Not only is it warm but it also allows the wearer the freedom of movement needed during outdoor activities like skiing or snowboarding:  Unlike lesser jackets, the waist doesn't ride up if you lift your arms above your head.

The Omni Heat + goose down combination is extremely effective.  I truly doubt anyone could ever feel cold while wearing this jacket.  I've even held my arm under a running tap to test the waterproofing; it passed with flying colours.

My only minor gripe about the jacket is its length.  I'm 6'4" so I wish it were just a little longer.  For people who are less tall, the length should be perfect.

In summary, if you're looking for the best jacket available for outdoor sports, save yourself some time and just buy yourself this Columbia.

product_title: Columbia Sportswear Men's Smooth Pursuit Softshell Tall Jacket
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Fit - The tall length is perfect for me (6'5") with adequate sleeve length
review_title: Fit - The tall length is perfect for me (6'5") with adequate sleeve length
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2014
review_body:
This jacket is replacing a North Face Windstopper fleece I have used for the last few years.  I have had number of soft-shells and fleeces over the years to compare to, here are my thoughts:

Fit - The tall length is perfect for me (6'5") with adequate sleeve length.  The width (girth) of the jacket seems a little big, if you are between sizes or unsure, go with the smaller size.

Construction - Seams seem good, and the jacket is well constructed of robust fabric that seems to be ubiquitous on soft shells.  The zipper is mid-level, and I wish a beefier one was there.

Overall, nice jacket would buy again for the price.

product_title: Columbia Sportswear Men's Cubist IV Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    great jacket, just what I needed.
review_title: great jacket, just what I needed.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2015
review_body: Good jacket. I have an old Columbia jacket I got from Kohl's about 8 years ago or so. That one is much bulkier than this one. Unfortunately I got this jacket towards the end of the winter season, so I did not get to test it in any sub-zero conditions, however I used it often when it was 15-35 degrees, and was quite comfortable in it. If you are somewhat active when wearing this jacket, then I do not think it will be a problem keeping you warm. However, if you are standing perfectly still (say, hunting for example) then as your body cools off, you may be slightly chilled. The hood is too big for a normal head, but I suppose its designed to work with a ski helmet. However, there is a nice velcro on the backside of the hood which allows you to sinch the hood down a bit and make it reasonable fit a head without a helmet. Also, the hood isn't insulated (thin), but it is waterproof. Also, I got a medium, as most things medium fit me at 5'8" and 165lbs, athletic, and this fits as expected.

product_title: LONDON FOG Men's Waterproof Breathable Seam Sealed Rip Stop Hooded Shell Jacket
reviews:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Lost in the fog
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2017
review_body:
I returned it.

Things I liked:

Size: The size was ok, I'm a fairly big guy (6'3" 225 lb) and a Large fit me ok. I don't lift weight though. No V shape.

Blue: I liked the blue. Not sure why the other person who left a review complained about it, its very obvious in the picture. Why would you buy it if you  didn't like blue.

The things I *didn't like* about it are:

Fabric: Its not a thin windbreaker jacket, its a fairly thick all artificial material rain jacket, the fabric makes noise when you wrinkle it or move, I felt that when I was walking it was going to be annoying. The whole jacket feels stiff. Like a straight jacket adn I didn't feel it was going to 'wear in' as its all man made and too thick to fold. It would be fine if you live in a rainy climate and protection is more important than style.

Hood: The hood is permanantly attached. Not a deal breaker but I didn't anticipate wearing it in the rain that much, it was mostly supposed to be a Fall and Spring jacket for me. The hood itself is nice and it fit my head nicely. Not too big. Again, I liked the blue.

Zipper: The zipper seems cheap with small teeth that I felt they were going to break with repeated use. Even zipping it up a couple times made me feel like I was damaging the teeth. Like they weren't aligned correctly, but they were of course. For a weather jacket the teeth should have been bigger and given the jacket a secure feel.

Flap: The the zipper has a top to botton flap that seals with a few velcro patches. You can see in the picture, it gives the jacket a sealed look covering the zipper. The flap gets in the way of trying to zipper up. The top part has a spread collar style and it was hard to zip all the way up and I found I was already fighting with the coat to get the velcro on the flap to line up. The spread collar aspect also creates an odd have open half closed feel to the top of the neck area that I didn't like. Like they were trying to design it to be open and closed at the same time... and failed. Its better zipped all teh way up with the flap closed but I didn't think I was going to be wearing it that way all the time so it failed the casual jacket test.

Sleeves: There is a velcro adjustment band on the sleeve ends. It just seemed poorly designed. I have long arms and the sleeves were adaquate, though not long. As long as I didn't have to raise my arms up they were going to be fine. Better than most sleeve lengths for a Large.

product_title: Columbia Men's Trail Turner Shell Jacket
reviews:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Not Quite Waterproof, Definitely Not Breathable
review_title: Not Quite Waterproof, Definitely Not Breathable
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2014
review_body:
Let me say this; it is only slightly water resistant, and certainly not breathable.

Bought this jacket because I needed a waterproof shell when I go on rock climbing trips (which involve hiking, camping, and backpacking) and for when I go cycling in light rain. Got this jacket at a local retailer for a great deal, and was super excited to try it in wet conditions.

I have to agree with another reviewer on here that claimed he got wet when wearing this jacket, and it was due to his own sweat. I experienced the same problem when I'm doing anything that causes me to perspire even a LITTLE bit. I find myself almost completely soaked when I remove my jacket after an extended length of time (45 min-2 hours). I would consider myself relatively fit, and that I don't sweat more than average. "Sweatier" individuals may experience this more extremely, as they're peeling off the jacket that is plastered to their skin.

In terms of water-proofing, it's only slightly better. Initial rain/moisture of any kind will run off due to gravity, and typically don't cause a problem. However, areas of the jacket that are perpendicular with gravity (such as the shoulders, hood, and certain creases in the sleeves), experience only a bit of run off leaving the water to soak into the shell. After a cold, wet day when I didn't sweat, I removed the jacket and found my arms to be slightly damp. Later that week I tested the jacket's water-resistance under the sink on the sleeve portion (for 30 seconds) and found that after most of the water had run off, there was still a damp area where water had soaked through.

I'd say it's a decent jacket for the price, but certainly wouldn't purchase it again knowing that it's not water-proof and not breathable (the two main features it claims to do).

Don't get caught up in the colors or the price of this jacket. There are better options and equivalent styles made by other companies.

reviews:

    Worked for me on Antarctica Trip
review_title: Worked for me on Antarctica Trip
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2014
review_body: By mistake I first posted review for a Columbia fleece jacket that I bought at the same time as this shell. I needed a shell for month long trip to Falklands, S. Georgia, and the Antarctic peninsula. When I saw this I was afraid it was not "tough" enough to hold up. But at the end it showed no signs of wear. My ski Northface XCR shell was much heavier than I needed (or had space to pack) for this trip. We were afraid our outer wear would have to be discarded after the trip due to residue Penguin poop smell. But that smell washed off without difficulty. So now I have a light shell to put over sweaters etc., for example, when shoveling snow.

review_title: Good fit, but doesn't breathe at all.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2014
review_body: I got this jacket for the mild Seattle fall/winter/spring rainy times. I love the fit and it is very waterproof, but if I work up any kind of sweat at all, the inside of the jacket ends up SOAKED with my sweat. This wouldn't be such a problem, except it claims to be breathable, and it isn't at all. If you are looking for something good to keep you dry while you stand and wait for the bus, get this one; if you want something to be at all active in, I would look elsewhere.

product_title: Columbia Men's Trail Turner Shell Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Good jacket
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2015
review_body:
The jacket is very stylish in my opinion. I have used this jacket anywhere from wearing it when it's a bit windy to taking it to the snow. It ventilates very well to keep you fresh during activities and you remain fresh while moving around. In one of my trips to South Lake Tahoe it kept me dry from the snow, I had a thermal underneath it and did not feel too hot while snowboarding.

I like to combine this jacket while wearing shorts with a tank top underneath and roll up the sleeves a bit. You do not get hot and it still will protect you from some wind, over all the jacket is great and very versatile. I would definitely recommend it and will purchase it again when needed, the only think I would recommend is to buy a size up if you will be using with multiple layers underneath.

product_title: Mens MA-1 Flight Bomber Jacket Active Casual Military Outwear
reviews:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Ok, but I don't settle any more...great if you want to look like the Stay-Puft guy
review_title: Ok, but I don't settle any more...great if you want to look like the Stay-Puft guy
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2018
review_body:
Thin-framed, 6'3", 205lbs. Size Large, Burgundy and Orange. The fit was good.

I really like the color of this jacket and being a Hokie fan, the reversible to Orange would have made that color actually a little useful as well. It fit well and was relatively comfortable.

My big problem though, is in the look of it. For years I had settled for clothes that didn't look or fit perfectly but were reasonably priced. I have a different standard now and this just didn't meet it.

I personally am not a fan of the external material. I don't know anything about it, but it's shiny and seems to hold creases.

The worst part for me though was the arms. They have a larger diameter giving me, what appear to be, really fat arms. I think I saw another person use the word 'poofy' which is exactly right. The "Erin Garments" jacket that I like is relatively tight to the arms and you can see a gap between the elbow and torso when your hands are in your pockets. But this jacket made me look like a a big, burgundy marshmallow.

A year ago I may have just sucked it up and been content with it. But I couldn't do it and had to return this.

I got this jacket after being VERY happy with another bomber, the "Erin Garments Padded Bomber Jacket" here on Amazon. It doesn't have as many colors but I'd recommend taking a look at it.

reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2018
review_body: I bought this jacket primarily because of the item description, with cost also being a factor. The next day, I decided to browse the reviews on the jacket and found mostly negative reviews concerning sizing, zippers, pockets, missing pockets, etc. Feeling certain that I would be returning this jacket, I ordered a similar jacket from a different seller at a significantly higher cost. I just received this jacket today and, I don't know, maybe I was lucky, but my jacket looks great! It fits perfectly and has none of the issues raised in other reviews. I don't know why that is, but I would definitely buy this jacket again, and I'm sorry I jumped the gun to buy another at a higher cost without first seeing this jacket for myself. Hopefully the second jacket is as good as this one.

reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Excellent Light Jacket
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2016
review_body: This is my second one of these jackets.  I had one for 2 years and it has been an incredible jacket.  Then I lost it and had to find another.  Luckily Amazon had it posted and I bought it again.  This jacket is so lightweight and warm.  It's got to weigh like 3 or 4 ounces.  Well maybe not that light, but you can barely tell you have it on.  Wind protection is fantastic.  It's very packable.  I can roll it up into a small ball that fits into my hand.  It has the Omni-Shield silver lining which "does" help to keep me warm in the Colorado winters.  It can be too light if the temp is too cold and you have wind and snow.  Otherwise, I wear this thing all the time.  The hood is nice but there is no way to secure it around your head (no drawstring).  Overall - excellent jacket.  Very versatile. Great price.

product_title: Columbia Men's Trail Fire Windbreaker Jacket (Small, Black)
reviews:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Beware, Too Small for Comfort
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2012
review_body: I wanted a windbreaker. I wear a Medium size. When the Columbia Men's Trail Fire Windbreaker arrived, not only was it tissue paper thin, but it was so small, I couldn't even get it on. The label read Medium, but it certainly was not Medium. I returned it for credit. It took many emails with the company asking for my email, before I finally understood that Amazon.com strips out any email in all correspondence, so if this happens to you, give you email, but put a dash or something other than the @ symbol. I have no idea why Amazon.com would strip away the email between a customer and one of their companies, but they do. Once they finally got my email straight, they send me a return authorization immediately. Some weeks later, and after the credit did not appear on my credit card for the return, I had to file another return with Amazon.com to get them to respond. Now, at last, they have credited my credit card, but not for the full amount. Only the windbreaker charge was credited. I didn't get credit for the Sales Tax I had to pay. I notified Amazon.com that the Sales Tax was not refunded, but I got the standard response from one of their computers. So beware. Not all Amazon.com products are what they appear to be.

product_title: Columbia Men's Tamiami Hurricane Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Good light weight jacket.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2019
review_body:
This jacket is very light weight and blocks the wind very well. Only downside is it is very thin so it will not keep you very warm. I had planned to use it with a sweatshirt underneath so this is not an issue for me but it’s something to keep in mind.

The teeth of the zipper are very small which I am not a fan of but isn’t a big issue. I’m not sure if it’s designed that way to help block more wind or not.

The front pockets are fairly spacious and zip closed. They are made of a mesh material.

I am 6’ and ~200lbs and the large fits nice, if a little loose.

product_title: Helly Hansen Men's Tofino Cis Jacket
Helly Hansen Men's Tofino Cis Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great Jacket for All Seasons
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2011
review_body:
To start, Helly items run small! Luckily, I was able to try one of these jackets on in my normal size (M) and it was too small. The Large was just fine!

The zip-in feature (like most of the upper-end jackets have nowadays) is great. Living in Florida, I can use it as a rain jacket most of the year, then zip-in the fleece for a colder weather jacket for the few months I need it. The breathability of the jacket is amazing. I never get sweaty wearing it when it warms up a little (or I warm up a little) and it has the zippable armpit areas for extra breathability.

The jacket is very waterproof and the hood will stay flipped up, if you will, to allow the water coming down the hood to run off the side, rather than in your face over the front of the hood. Handy feature when it's raining or there is a tropical storm...

Overall, great jacket for the price. I hope to have mine for a long time!

reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Already in love
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021
review_body:
This will probably be the first review on this item, so I’ll make it as useful and possible!

I’m going on a big bear camping trip this weekend and it’s going to be 25 degrees at night and 55 degrees in the day time. I needed a nice comfortable jacket to keep me warm at night, so I went with Fjallraven!

Upon receiving this item (which came a full day earlier) I was happy that it fit perfectly. I ordered a size XS in mens. For size reference I have a slim build, 5’6” 125lbs. The length is perfect and the sleeve length is perfect. There’s just enough room to wear a sweater underneath. The jacket isn’t too puffy at all and it’s very comfortable. I’ve been wearing it since I opened it 4 hours ago. I wish there was forest green available, but I’m 100% happy with the black. We’ll see how it holds up on my big bear camping trip!

product_title: Columbia Men's Triple Trail Shell
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Best Purchase of the Year
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2013
review_body:
I bought the Columbia Men's Triple Trail shell and it has been excellent in all kinds of weather. Ever since I bought it, the weather where I live has been in the negative. The Omni-heat inside of the coat has kept me warm even with just wearing a short sleeve shirt. The Omni-tech on the outside of the coat has been excellent repelling rain, snow and ice while the water-tight zippers keep the moisture from entering inside the jacket. The hood fits over helmets for skiing and snowboarding. The cuffs are velcro and adjustable. It is very light-weight and durable. It has two zippers on the main zipper so when it gets too hot on the slopes, you can just zip the bottom one to cool down without having to unzip the whole jacket.

  It's the best Columbia jacket I have ever owned and I've owned 8 Columbia jackets now. I feel like the sizing is right on for me, but I guess it depends on what you do and how many layers you plan on wearing underneath. I doubt you will need to wear multiple layers because of how warm the coat will keep you even with just a long sleeve shirt underneath. I highly recommend this jacket!

product_title: Columbia Men's Triple Trail Shell
reviews:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Cut is not for the athletic body shape.
review_title: Cut is not for the athletic body shape.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2013
review_body:
It's the fist time I buy a Columbia product but I don't think their cut fits the athletic body type.
The jacket runs very tight under the arms on me. It is uncomfortable. If you're a v-shape kinda guy,
it might not be for you. Going a size higher wont help as the jacket is then too long and the sleeves too.
Apart from the cut, it's a great jacket.

product_title: Columbia Men's Triple Trail Shell
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great Shell, Bad Zipper
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2014
review_body:
It feels durable and it does an excellent job stopping the snow and wind even in gusts 60+ mph. I've worn it on a few winter hikes in NH and my only complaint is that the zipper tends to jam. I talked to Columbia about this problem and they advised me to buy some zipper lubricant and try that. The zipper lube improved things enough that I'll keep the jacket but my confidence in it is a little shaken. It's not good when you have to take your gloves off and use both hands to finish zipping your hard shell. If it weren't for the zipper problem this would be a 5 star shell.

Sizing: I usually wear a medium jacket but I ordered this in large because I tend to wear it over multiple fleece layers. When I'm layered up it fits pretty good. The arms are a little long but that doesn't really bother me.

product_title: Columbia Men's Triple Trail Shell

review_title: Excellent protection during northeaster storm in Massachusets

Was wearing a fleece jacket as 1st inner layer.
Midlayer was a Mountain Hardwear Zonal Jacket.
This shell was excellent protecting from cold wind/ rain/snow.
ORDER a size LARGER. Needless to say, this shell is the last part of your layering system.

product_title: Venustas Backup Battery with 12V/7.4V output, and 12V Heated Canvas Jacket for Men with Battery Included (Male, Black, 3X-Large)
Salomon Men's Charvin Softshell Jacket
Salomon Men's Charvin Softshell Jacket
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Excellent Jacket:  Stylish and Functional
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2014
review_body:
This jacket is a great running jacket for mild temperatures.  As long as you know what your getting, you'll love it.  It is a breathable, form fitting jacket great for cold windy days.  Once you get colder than 30 degrees fahrenheit you will probably need an additional layer below, or a heavier jacket.  Also, water resistance is minimal.  Do not wear this jacket in significant rain.  A mist is fine, as the jacket has some water resistant properties, but the approach for this jacket is breathability over protection from the elements.

Fit:  I am a 5'10" male, 160 lb who wears almost exclusively medium clothing.  This jacket, like all other Salomon apparel I own, fits perfectly.

Style:  One of my favorite features of this jacket is the look.  I own the black jacket with red zipper and it is one of the best looking jackets I have ever seen.

Bottom Line:  If you want to look good, stay relatively warm, and not be bogged down by heavy clothing, I fully recommend this jacket.

product_title: Gore Bike Wear Men's Contest 2.0 Active Shell Jacket, Red/Black/White, Small
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    A really good cycling wind breaker
review_title: A really good cycling wind breaker
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2013
review_body:
I wanted something to keep the wind off me during chilly morning rides, this fits the bill perfectly.  Easily packs down into a jersey pocket when it warms up.  I have been really impressed with how well this stops the wind given how light it is.  Build quality is top notch.

I am 6'3", 195lbs with a 42" chest, shirt size is 16 1/2 x 35. After obsessing for a couple of days I went with the XXL based on the sizing chart on the Gore website and off of a few reviews I found on the web.  When I got it the chest seemed a little bigger than I expected, but the sleeve length was just right.  Thought about returning it for an XL, but I was afraid the sleeves might be too short.  Turns out the extra fabric in the chest is not a problem at all with just a jersey underneath, and will probably be a benefit if I want to layer it over something warmer.

Highly recommended.

review_body: I use this jacket as a shell in cold, wet, or windy riding. It works well at keeping water and wind off of your body. It fits close to the body, like lots of cycling clothing. I'm able to wear a Pearl Izumi Thermal Select long sleeve + a base layer underneath of it.  However if you wanted to use a lot of thicker layers underneath you might want to go up a size.
